Platform.Title: M. tuberculosis (PFGRC)_version 3
Platform.Description:
http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/array_description/mycobacterium_tuberculosis/version3.html Microarray Version: 3 Number of Grids: 48 Element Type: 70mer Oligonucleotide Surface Coating: Epoxy Oligonucleotides Designed: 4750 Replicate Oligo Printings: 6x Controls: 500 Arabidopsis thaliana 70mers
The Platform data table is a condensed representation of the array's replicate oligos. The full array layout file is linked below as a supplementary file. The oligo sequence info for this array (obtained at: ftp://ftp.jcvi.org/pub/data/PFGRC/microarray_annotation/M_tuberculosis/version3/M_tuberculosis_3_H37Rv.ann) has been linked below as a supplementary file.

Sample.Title: Pre-diamide 1

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis delta-sigmaH mutant at log phase
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Mehra S & Kaushal D. J. Bacteriol. In Press.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: M. tuberculosis and its isogenic mutant were grown in Middlebrook's 7H9 supplemented media. Specific manipulations are mentioned in Mehra S & Kaushal D. J. Bacteriol. In Press.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA extracted using Trizol/Beadbeater method using a Biospec Beadbeater and 0.1 mm silica/zirconia beads
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis at log phase
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Mehra S & Kaushal D. J. Bacteriol. In Press.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: M. tuberculosis and its isogenic mutant were grown in Middlebrook's 7H9 supplemented media. Specific manipulations are mentioned in Mehra S & Kaushal D. J. Bacteriol. In Press.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA extracted using Trizol/Beadbeater method using a Biospec Beadbeater and 0.1 mm silica/zirconia beads
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Scan-Protocol: scanned on an Axon 4000B scanner using GenePix 6.1
Sample.Data-Processing: LOWESS normalized, background subtracted data obtained from log2 of processed Red signal/processed Green signal, using S+ ArrayAnalyzer/Spotfire

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalized log2 ratio (Cy5/Cy3) representing test/reference (ie, wt/mutant)

Series.Title: Functional Genomics Reveals Extended Roles of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis Stress Response Factor sigmaH
Series.Summary:
DNA Microarray based comparison of M. tuberculosis and its isogenic delta-sigmaH mutant for an extended period of time, using a diamide-stress and removal strategy (post-diamide stress or PDS)
Raw data has been requested of, but not provided by, the submitter.
Series.Overall-Design: Two strains, M. tuberculosis vs delta-sigmaH mutant. At Pre-diamide (control), 0' 30' 60' 90' and 120' post-diamide stress, two biological replicates, six replicates per array
